summary: This is an email chain between a US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) prosecutor and an FBI agent from the New York Office discussing the investigation of Ghislaine Maxwell. The FBI agent provides information linking a KIK messenger account to Maxwell, including a profile photo match and associated email address, and mentions attachments including a subpoena and screenshots of a conversation between Maxwell and a victim's mother containing a partially nude image of a minor.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The primary subject of the email discussion. An FBI agent reports that a KIK messenger account with a username and profile photograph matching Maxwell has been identified and is tied to an email address.

persons.name: ADA
persons.context: Provided information to the FBI agent confirming that the profile photograph on the identified KIK account matches Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: The ADA provided identification information to the FBI, confirming a KIK profile photo matched Maxwell, establishing a link in the investigation.

events.title: Initial FBI case summary sent
events.description: An FBI agent from the New York Office sends an initial case summary regarding Ghislaine Maxwell to a US Attorney's Office prosecutor.

events.title: FBI provides KIK account evidence
events.description: An FBI agent follows up with detailed evidence, including a KIK messenger account linked to Maxwell via email and a matching profile photo, and references attachments including a subpoena and conversation screenshots.

locations: US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
keyFacts: Investigators identified a KIK messenger account believed to belong to Ghislaine Maxwell, with a username consistent with her other aliases and a profile photo confirmed by an ADA to match her.
The KIK account was linked to a specific email address via a subpoena to KIK messenger.

The FBI agent references attached screenshots of a conversation between Maxwell and a victim's mother, which contained a partially nude image of a minor, explicitly noted as not being child pornography.
The communication shows active coordination between the FBI's Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force and the US Attorney's Office in building evidence against Maxwell in September 2020.
